title: [ICE] async fn vs lint order

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Polish
labels.description: Async-await issues that are part of the "polish" area

body:
[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c82e19e49b2ee81abed7824ef5e31c54)
ICE when some lints fail on an async-fn. Make the xs mutable and no ICE.
```rust
#![feature(async_await)]

// x should be mutable
pub async fn f(x: Option<usize>) {
    x.take();
}

// without the above failure, this fails as expected
pub async fn g(x: usize) {
    x += 1;
}
```
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: variable `a` is assigned to, but never used
 --> src/lib.rs:8:16
  |
8 | pub async fn g(a: usize) {
  |                ^
  |
  = note: #[warn(unused_variables)] on by default
  = note: consider using `_a` instead

warning: value assigned to `a` is never read
 --> src/lib.rs:9:5
  |
9 |     a += 1;
  |     ^
  |
  = note: #[warn(unused_assignments)] on by default
  = help: maybe it is overwritten before being read?

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/libcore/option.rs:347:21
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:197

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:211

   7: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:478

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:381
   9: rust_begin_unwind
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:308
  10: core::panicking::panic_fmt
             at src/libcore/panicking.rs:85
  11: core::panicking::panic
             at src/libcore/panicking.rs:49
  12: rustc_mir::borrow_check::mutability_errors::<impl rustc_mir::borrow_check::MirBorrowckCtxt>::report_mutability_error
  13: rustc_mir::borrow_check::MirBorrowckCtxt::access_place

  20: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_borrowck] processing `f::{{closure}}#0`
#1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
